data.title: Hollyoaks theory: Mass exits as John Paul McQueen causes death tragedy?
data.meta_description: HOLLYOAKS' John Paul McQueen hits rock bottom in upcoming scenes on the Channel 4 soap but as his alcoholism sees him reach new lows, a new theory from Express.co.uk suggests there could be a number of cast exits on the horizon.
data.text:
HOLLYOAKS' John Paul McQueen hits rock bottom in upcoming scenes on the Channel 4 soap but as his alcoholism sees him reach new lows, a new theory from Express.co.uk suggests there could be a number of cast exits on the horizon.

By Charlie Milward

Link copied Bookmark

Hollyoaks: Sarah Jayne Dunn's final scene as Mandy Richardson

John Paul (played by James Sutton) has been struggling with his addiction to alcohol in recent weeks on Hollyoaks, with the school teacher letting other villagers take the wrap for his reckless behaviour. Unfortunately, he has no way out in next week's episodes of the Channel 4 soap as he decides he is going to drive a bus full of children from the village whilst under the influence. It's not been confirmed whether someone will be leaving the television programme but the official soap spoilers have revealed lives will be hanging in the balance.

The drama begins next week on the weeknight serial drama, having been previously teased in the show's official spring trailer.

John Paul will be joined on the trip by his colleague, Olivia Bradshaw (Emily Burnett), after Nancy Osborne (Jessica Fox) has her right to go revoked.

Although he has been confiding in his cousin Prince McQueen (Malique Thompson-Dwyer) about his problems, this is still not enough to make the beloved character stay away from the bottle.

As he prepares to go on the trip, the school teacher finds a small bottle of vodka in his pocket and decides to drink it.

This only makes matters worse when the iconic McQueen clan member is made the designated driver of the mini-bus to assort the children to their destination.

READ MORE: Coronation Street youngster Jack Webster exits in heartbreaking twist?

As the children grow more and more out of control, John Paul finds it increasingly difficult to concentrate on the task at hand.

Unfortunately, the first hiccup they face is getting lost on their way to the campsite but the situation only gets more dangerous.

When the driver decides to shut his eyes whilst behind the wheel, the vehicle crashes and turns on its side because of John Paul's actions.

With the school teacher getting out of the mini-bus, his colleague Olivia comes to the rescue as she tries to save the children trapped inside.

This includes Leah Barnes (Elá-May Demircan), Charlie Dean (Charlie Behan), Ella Richardson (Erin Palmer), Mason Chen-Williams (Frank Kauer) and newcomer, Freya.

Invalid email

We use your sign-up to provide content in ways you've consented to and to improve our understanding of you. This may include adverts from us and 3rd parties based on our understanding. You can unsubscribe at any time. Read our Privacy Policy

It's almost a natural progression

James Sutton

It seems the first casualty could be Freya as Mason tells his school teachers she is trapped under the luggage in the mini-bus.

Olivia believes she can rescue the young girl but soon tragedy strikes and John Paul makes a disturbing discovery as the paramedics arrive on the scene.

By the end of the week, the beloved character is facing a lot of questions as the loved ones of those injured and possibly killed want answers.

John Paul will be grappling with his guilt as it seems there is nowhere left for him to turn and he has to face up to what he's done.

Ahead of the episodes airing, it seems there are going to be multiple exits, with the most likely candidate to leave being Olivia.

DON'T MISS...

Hollyoaks' Jamie Lomas shuts down two companies with debts of £92,000 [COMMENT]

Hollyoaks star Lysette Anthony slams bosses amid race row [COMMENT]

Hollyoaks' Amanda Clapham left with swollen thumb from spider [COMMENT]

Olivia only joined the show last year as the fiancée of established character Prince, who made his return to the village after some years away.

She has struggled to make friends in Hollyoaks and hasn't been accepted by the McQueens because of her prudish attitude.

However, if she were to be killed off, Prince would want revenge on John Paul for causing the death of the love of his life.

Some of the children could be making an exit as well, with newcomer Freya a likely candidate to become a victim of the disaster.

Given how much heartache Charlie has been through recently, he could also be someone who is going to make a departure.

Die hard fan

You love watching the soaps so much your entire week is planned around when they air

With his girlfriend Ella having suffered a miscarriage and having been locked behind bars last year as a result of the County Lines storyline, this could be a heartbreaking end to his time on the show.

It would launch new plots for Ella as she deals with the loss of her ex-boyfriend as well as the grief Nancy will go through having lost the last person connected to her late sister.

Mason could also be killed off as he was only introduced to the show late last year as a member of the newest family in the village.

The youngster hasn't been involved in a lot of storylines since he arrived but his death could spark a dark new direction for the Chen-Williams'.

At the moment, writers are keeping the conclusion of the bus crash a tightly guarded secret but could this theory wind up to be true?

The actor who plays John Paul, James, has spoken out about the latest development in his character's addiction storyline.

James explained: "It's almost a natural progression for John Paul [following the abuse storyline he was a part of last year].

"It's going to be a long-running story because once you're an addict, you're always an addict.

"But John Paul has a loving and supportive family around him, so you will get to see that caring side of the McQueens – which is also important."

Hollyoaks airs weeknights at 6:30pm on Channel 4. First-look Hollyoaks airs weeknights at 7pm on E4 or viewers can watch the new episode from 7am the same day on All 4.
